sentences.en: After a long drive they finally hauled into town at dusk.
sentences.cn: 他们经过长途奔驰,终于在黄昏时来到了城里.

sentences.en: As the dusk shaded into night, we drove slowly through narrow alleys.
sentences.cn: 夜幕渐渐降临，我们驱车在狭窄的胡同里缓慢前行。

sentences.en: At dusk more fish come into the shallows.
sentences.cn: 黄昏时分，更多的鱼游到了浅水区。

sentences.en: At dusk we pitched camp in the middle of nowhere.
sentences.cn: 黄昏时，我们在茫茫荒野中扎营。

sentences.en: By dusk we were dog-tired and heading for home.
sentences.cn: 到了傍晚我们累趴下了，于是回家。

sentences.en: Dusk was deepening as they drove back to the lights of Shillingham.
sentences.cn: 他们驱车返回华灯初上的希灵汉姆时，暮色渐浓。

sentences.en: Paul talked unceasingly from dawn to dusk.
sentences.cn: 保罗滔滔不绝地从早说到晚。

sentences.en: She was invisible in the dusk of the room.
sentences.cn: 她在昏暗的房间里别人看不到她.

sentences.en: Spreading shades of dusk cover the earth.
The army imposed a dusk-to-dawn curfew.
sentences.cn: 军队强制实行黄昏至黎明的宵禁。

sentences.en: The lighthouse beam was quite distinct in the gathering dusk.
sentences.cn: 灯塔的光束在渐浓的暮色中清晰可见。

sentences.en: The street lights come on at dusk and go off at dawn.
sentences.cn: 路灯在黄昏时开,拂晓时关.

sentences.en: The street lights go on at dusk .
sentences.cn: 街灯在黄昏时分亮起来。

sentences.en: The street lights go on at dusk.

words.tran_cn: 暗淡的；微暗的；忧郁的；朦胧的

trans.tran_en: the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright
